name: Lemon-Sumac Pork Chops with Roasted Broccoli
description: Quick-seared pork chops finished with a bright lemon-sumac drizzle, served alongside crisp roasted broccoli. Mild, keto-friendly, and ready in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Cut broccoli into medium florets; dry well.
Pat pork chops dry; set out spices, salt, and pepper.
cook_steps: Toss broccoli with 1.5 tbsp olive oil, a big pinch of salt, and black pepper; spread on a sheet pan.
Roast broccoli for 15–18 minutes until edges are browned and tender.
While broccoli roasts, season pork chops on both sides with 1 tsp salt, black pepper, oregano, and half the sumac.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high until shimmering.
Sear pork chops 3–4 minutes per side until nicely browned and just cooked through (internal temp ~63°C/145°F); rest on a plate.
Turn heat to low; add remaining 0.5 tbsp olive oil and garlic to the skillet. Stir 20–30 seconds until fragrant.
Stir in lemon juice and remaining sumac to make a quick pan drizzle, scraping up browned bits. Remove from heat.
Plate pork chops with roasted broccoli. Spoon lemon-sumac drizzle over the chops and a little over broccoli. Sprinkle lemon zest and parsley to finish.
